summary.long: Joshua is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: After the death of Yahweh’s servant Moses, Yahweh said to Moses’ assistant Joshua, son of Nun,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My servant Moses is dead. Now you and all these people must cross the Jordan River into the land that I am going to give the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give you every place on which you set foot, as I promised Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your borders will be the desert on the south, nearby Lebanon to the Euphrates River (the country of the Hittites) on the north, and the Mediterranean Sea on the west.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one will be able to oppose you successfully as long as you live. I will be with you as I was with Moses. I will never neglect you or abandon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be strong and courageous, because you will help these people take possession of the land I swore to give their ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Only be strong and very courageous, faithfully doing everything in the teachings that my servant Moses commanded you. Don’t turn away from them. Then you will succeed wherever you go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never stop reciting these teachings. You must think about them night and day so that you will faithfully do everything written in them. Only then will you prosper and succeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have commanded you, ‘Be strong and courageous! Don’t tremble or be terrified, because Yahweh your Elohim is with you wherever you go.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua ordered the officers of the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go through the camp. Tell the people, ‘Get your supplies ready. In three days you will cross the Jordan River to take possession of the land Yahweh your Elohim is going to give you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next, Joshua said to the tribes of Reuben and Gad and half of the tribe of Manasseh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Remember what Yahweh’s servant Moses commanded you. Moses said, ‘Yahweh your Elohim will give you this land—a place to rest.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your wives, children, and livestock may stay in the land that Moses gave you east of the Jordan River. However, all your best soldiers must march in battle formation ahead of your relatives. You must help your relatives
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: take possession of the land Yahweh your Elohim is going to give them. Then they will have a place to rest like you do. After that, you may go back and take possession of the land east of the Jordan River which Yahweh’s servant Moses gave you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people responded to Joshua, “We’ll do everything you tell us and go wherever you send us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will obey you as we obeyed Moses. May Yahweh your Elohim be with you as he was with Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever rebels against your authority or does not obey your orders will be put to death. Just be strong and courageous!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Shittim Joshua, son of Nun, secretly sent out two men as spies. He told them, “Go, look at that country, especially the city of Jericho.” So they went to Jericho and entered the house of a prostitute named Rahab to spend the night there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king of Jericho was told, “Some Israelites have entered the city tonight. They came to gather information about our land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king of Jericho sent messengers to Rahab, who told her, “Bring out the men who came to your house. They came here to gather information about the entire land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the woman had already taken the two men inside and hidden them. So she said, “Yes, the men did come here. But I didn’t know where they had come from.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was dark and the gate was just about to close, they left. I don’t know where they went. If you hurry, you’ll catch up with them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (She had taken them up to the roof and covered them with the flax which she had laid up there.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king’s men pursued them on the road leading to a shallow place to cross the Jordan River. As soon as the king’s men had left, the gate was closed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before the spies fell asleep, Rahab went up to them on the roof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said to them, “I know Yahweh will give you this land. Your presence terrifies us. All the people in this country are deathly afraid of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We’ve heard how Yahweh dried up the water of the Red Sea in front of you when you left Egypt. We’ve also heard what you did to Sihon and Og, the two kings of the Amorites, who ruled east of the Jordan River. We’ve heard how you destroyed them for the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When we heard about it, we lost heart. There was no courage left in any of us because of you. Yahweh your Elohim is the Elohim of heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please swear by Yahweh that you’ll be as kind to my father’s family as I’ve been to you. Also give me some proof
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you’ll protect my father, mother, brothers, sisters, and their households, and that you’ll save us from death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men promised her, “We pledge our lives for your lives. If you don’t tell anyone what we’re doing here, we’ll treat you kindly and honestly when Yahweh gives us this land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she let them down by a rope from her window since her house was built into the city wall. (She lived in the city wall.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She told them, “Go to the mountains so that the men who are pursuing you will not find you. Hide there for three days until they return to Jericho. Then you can go on your way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men told her, “We will be free from the oath which you made us swear, if you tell anyone what we’re doing here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When we invade your land, tie this red cord in the window through which you let us down. Also, gather your father, mother, brothers, and all your father’s family into your house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever leaves your house will be responsible for his own life. We will be free from that responsibility. But we will take responsibility if anyone inside your house is harmed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you tell anyone what we’re doing here, we will be free from the oath which you made us swear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I agree,” she said. So she let them go and tied the red cord in the window.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men went to the mountains and stayed there for three days until the king’s men returned to Jericho. The king’s men had searched for them all along the road but had not found them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the two spies came down out of the mountains, crossed the Jordan River, and returned to Joshua, son of Nun. They told him everything that had happened to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told Joshua, “Yahweh has given us the whole country. The people who live there are deathly afraid of us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua got up early the next morning. He and all the Israelites left Shittim. They came to the Jordan River, where they camped before crossing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three days later the officers went through the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told the people, “As soon as you see the ark of the promise of Yahweh your Elohim and the Levitical priests who carry it, break camp and follow them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, stay about half a mile behind them. Don’t come any closer to them so that you will know which way to go because you have not gone this way before.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua told the people, “Perform the ceremonies to make yourselves holy because tomorrow Yahweh will do miracles among you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua also told the priests, “Take the ark of the promise, and go ahead of the people.” They did as they were told.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh said to Joshua, “Today I will begin to honor you in front of all the people of Israel. I will do this to let them know that I am with you just as I was with Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Order the priests who carry the ark of the promise, ‘When you step into the water of the Jordan River, stand there.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua said to the people of Israel, “Come here, and listen to the words of Yahweh your Elohim.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua continued, “This is how you will know that El Chay is among you and that he will certainly force the Canaanites, Hittites, Hivites, Perizzites, Girgashites, Amorites, and Jebusites out of your way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch the ark of the promise of the Adonay of the whole earth as it goes ahead of you into the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Choose one man from each of the 12 tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests who carry the ark of Yahweh, the Adonay of the whole earth, will stand in the water of the Jordan. Then the water flowing from upstream will stop and stand up like a dam.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they broke camp to cross the Jordan River. The priests who carried the ark of the promise went ahead of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (The Jordan overflows all its banks during the harvest season.) When the priests who were carrying the ark came to the edge of the Jordan River and set foot in
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the water, the water stopped flowing from upstream. The water rose up like a dam as far away as the city of Adam near Zarethan. The water flowing down toward the Sea of the Plains (the Dead Sea) was completely cut off. Then the people crossed from the east side of the Jordan River directly opposite Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests who carried the ark of Yahweh’s promise stood firmly on dry ground in the middle of the Jordan until the whole nation of Israel had crossed the Jordan River on dry ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole nation finished crossing the Jordan River. Yahweh had told Joshua,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Choose one man from each of the 12 tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Order them to pick up 12 stones from the middle of the Jordan, where the priests’ feet stood firmly. Take the stones along with you, and set them down where you will camp tonight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua called the 12 men whom he had selected (one from each tribe).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Go to the middle of the Jordan River in front of the ark of Yahweh your Elohim. Each man must take a stone on his shoulder, one for each tribe of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This will be a sign for you. In the future your children will ask, ‘What do these stones mean to you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You should answer, ‘The water of the Jordan River was cut off in front of the ark of Yahweh’s promise. When the ark crossed the Jordan, the river stopped flowing. These stones are a permanent reminder for the people of Israel.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Israel did as Joshua had ordered. They took 12 stones, one for each of the tribes of Israel. They took them from the middle of the Jordan as Yahweh had told Joshua. They carried them to the camp and set them down there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua also set 12 stones in the middle of the Jordan River, where the priests who carried the ark of the promise had stood. The stones are still there today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests who carried the ark remained standing in the middle of the Jordan. They stood there until everything Yahweh had ordered Joshua to tell the people had been carried out. This was as Moses had told Joshua. The people hurried to the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as everyone had crossed, the priests with Yahweh’s ark crossed and went ahead of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Reuben, Gad, and half of the tribe of Manasseh did as Moses had told them. They marched across in battle formation ahead of the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About 40,000 armed men crossed the river in front of Yahweh to the plains of Jericho for battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day Yahweh honored Joshua in the presence of all the Israelites. As long as Joshua lived, the Israelites respected him in the same way they had respected Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Joshua,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Order the priests who carry the ark of the testimony to come out of the Jordan River.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua ordered the priests, “Come out of the Jordan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests who carried the ark of Yahweh’s promise came out of the middle of the Jordan. When their feet stepped onto dry land, the water of the Jordan returned to its seasonal flood level.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the tenth day of the first month, the people came out of the Jordan River. They made their camp at Gilgal, just east of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At Gilgal Joshua set up the 12 stones they had taken from the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the people of Israel, “In the future when children ask their parents, ‘What do these stones mean?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the children should be told that Israel crossed the Jordan River on dry ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh your Elohim dried up the Jordan ahead of you until you had crossed, as he did to the Red Sea until we had crossed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh did this so that everyone in the world would know his mighty power and that you would fear Yahweh your Elohim every day of your life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the Amorite kings west of the Jordan River and all the Canaanite kings along the Mediterranean Sea heard that Yahweh had dried up the Jordan River so that the Israelites could cross. So they lost heart and had no courage left to face the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Yahweh spoke to Joshua, “Make flint knives, and circumcise the men of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua made flint knives and circumcised the men of Israel at the Hill of Circumcision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the reason Joshua circumcised them: All the soldiers had died on the way through the desert after they left Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men who left Egypt had been circumcised. However, the men born later, on the way through the desert, were not circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For 40 years the Israelites wandered through the desert until all their soldiers who left Egypt died. They died because they disobeyed Yahweh. Yahweh swore that he would not let them see this land flowing with milk and honey which Yahweh had sworn to give our ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons who took their place had not been circumcised on the way. So Joshua circumcised them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the men had been circumcised, they remained in the camp until they recovered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Joshua, “Today I have removed the disgrace of Egypt from you.” So Joshua named the place Gilgal, the name it still has today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Israel camped at Gilgal in the Jericho plain. There they celebrated the Passover on the evening of the fourteenth day of the month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the day after the Passover, they ate some of the produce of the land, unleavened bread and roasted grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The day after that, the manna stopped. The people of Israel never had manna again. That year they began to eat the crops that grew in Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joshua was near Jericho, he looked up and saw a man standing in front of him with a sword in his hand. Joshua went up to him and asked, “Are you one of us or one of our enemies?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “Neither one! I am here as the commander of Yahweh’s army.” Immediately, Joshua bowed with his face touching the ground and worshiped. He asked, “Sir, what do you want to tell me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The commander of Yahweh’s army said to Joshua, “Take off your sandals because this place where you are standing is holy.” So Joshua did as he was told.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jericho was bolted and barred shut because the people were afraid of the Israelites. No one could enter or leave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Joshua, “I am about to hand Jericho, its king, and its warriors over to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the soldiers will march around the city once a day for six days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven priests will carry rams’ horns ahead of the ark. But on the seventh day you must march around the city seven times while the priests blow their horns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you hear a long blast on the horn, all the troops must shout very loudly. The wall around the city will collapse. Then the troops must charge straight ahead into the city.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua, son of Nun, summoned the priests. He said to them, “Pick up the ark of the promise, and have seven priests carry seven rams’ horns ahead of Yahweh’s ark.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told the troops, “March around the city. Let the armed men march ahead of Yahweh’s ark.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Joshua had given orders to the troops, the seven priests carrying the seven rams’ horns ahead of Yahweh marched off as they blew their horns. The ark of Yahweh’s promise followed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The armed men went ahead of the priests, who blew their horns. The rear guard followed the ark while the priests continued to blow their horns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua ordered the troops, “Don’t shout, make any noise, or let one word come out of your mouth until I tell you to shout. Then shout!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Yahweh’s ark went around the city once. Then they went back to the camp and stayed there for the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua got up early in the morning. The priests carried Yahweh’s ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seven priests carrying the seven rams’ horns were ahead of it. The priests blew their horns as they went. The armed men were ahead of them, and the rear guard followed Yahweh’s ark while the horns blew continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went around the city once on the second day and returned to the camp. They did this for six days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the seventh day they got up at dawn. They marched around the city seven times the same way they had done it before. That was the only day they marched around it seven times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they went around the seventh time, the priests blew their rams’ horns.
Joshua said to the troops, “Shout, because Yahweh has given you the city!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The city has been claimed by the Lord. Everything in it belongs to Yahweh. Only the prostitute Rahab and all who are in the house with her will live because she hid the messengers we sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But stay away from what has been claimed by the Lord for destruction, or you, too, will be destroyed by the Lord. If you take anything that is claimed by the Lord, you will bring destruction and disaster on the camp of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the silver and gold and everything made of bronze and iron are holy and belong to Yahweh. They must go into Yahweh’s treasury.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the troops shouted very loudly when they heard the blast of the rams’ horns, and the wall collapsed. The troops charged straight ahead and captured the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They claimed everything in it for the Lord. With their swords they killed men and women, young and old, as well as cattle, sheep, and donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Joshua said to the two spies, “Go to the prostitute’s house. Bring the woman out, along with everything she has, as you swore you would do for her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The spies went and brought out Rahab, her father, mother, brothers, everything she had, and even all of her relatives. They gave them a place outside the camp of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Israel burned the city and everything in it. But they put the silver and gold and everything made of bronze and iron into Yahweh’s treasury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua spared the prostitute Rahab, her father’s family, and everything she had. She still lives in Israel today because she hid the messengers Joshua had sent to look at Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At that time Joshua pronounced this curse:
“Yahweh will curse
    whoever comes to rebuild the city of Jericho.
        It will cost him his firstborn son
            to lay the foundation.
        It will cost him his youngest son
            to set up the city doors.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Yahweh was with Joshua, and his fame spread throughout the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Israel proved to be disloyal about the things claimed by the Lord. Achan, son of Carmi, grandson of Zabdi, great-grandson of Zerah, and a member of the tribe of Judah, took something that had been claimed by the Lord. So Yahweh became angry with the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai. Ai is near Beth Aven, east of Bethel. He said to them, “Go, look at that country.” So the men went and looked at Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came back to Joshua and told him, “You don’t need to send all the troops. Only about two or three thousand men are needed to destroy Ai. Don’t tire the troops out by sending all of them. There are only a few troops in Ai.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So about three thousand men were sent. However, they fled from the men of Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Ai killed about thirty-six of them, chasing them from the city gate to the slope of the stone quarries. Israel’s troops lost heart and were scared stiff.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua and the leaders of Israel tore their clothes in grief. They put dust on their heads and bowed down to the ground in front of Yahweh’s ark. They stayed there until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said, “Adonay Yahweh, why did you bring these people across the Jordan River? Was it to hand us over to the Amorites so that they could destroy us? I wish we had been content to live on the other side of the Jordan!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adonay, what else can I say after Israel ran away from its enemy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Canaanites and everyone who lives in the land hears about it, they will surround us and remove every memory of us from the earth. What will you do then so that your great name will be remembered?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Joshua, “Get up! What are you doing bowing on the ground?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel has sinned. They have ignored the requirements that I have placed on them. They have taken what I claimed for myself and put it among their own goods. They have not only stolen, but they have also lied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The people of Israel will not be able to defend themselves against their enemies. They will run away from their enemies because the people of Israel are now claimed for destruction. I will not be with you anymore unless you destroy what I have claimed for myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Get up! Tell the people, ‘Get ready for tomorrow by performing the ceremonies to make yourselves holy. This is what Yahweh Elohim of Israel says: You have what I claimed for myself, Israel. You will not be able to defend yourselves against your enemies until you get rid of what I have claimed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning come forward by tribes to the tent of meeting. The tribe Yahweh selects will come forward by families. Then the family Yahweh selects will come forward by households, and the household Yahweh selects will come forward man by man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man who is selected, along with everything he has, must be burned because he has stolen what the Lord has claimed. He has ignored Yahweh’s requirements and done a godless thing in Israel.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua got up early in the morning. He had Israel come forward by tribes. The tribe of Judah was selected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he had the families of Judah come forward, and the family of Zerah was selected. Then he had the family of Zerah come forward man by man, and Zabdi was selected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he had Zabdi’s household come forward man by man, and Achan was selected. Achan from the tribe of Judah was the son of Carmi, grandson of Zabdi, and great-grandson of Zerah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to Achan, “Son, give honor and praise to Yahweh Elohim of Israel! Tell me what you have done. Don’t hide anything from me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Achan answered Joshua, “It’s true. I have sinned against Yahweh Elohim of Israel. This is what I did:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw a fine robe from Babylonia, five pounds of silver, and a bar of gold weighing about one pound among the loot. I wanted them, so I took them. You will find them buried inside my tent with the silver beneath them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua sent messengers, and they ran to the tent. The loot was buried inside with the silver beneath it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took the loot from the tent and brought it to Joshua and all the people of Israel. Then they laid it out in the presence of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua and all Israel took Achan (son of Zerah), the silver, the robe, the bar of gold, his sons and daughters, his cattle, his donkeys, his sheep, and his tent—everything he had—and brought them to the valley of Achor [Disaster].
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua said, “Why did you bring this disaster on us? Yahweh will bring disaster on you today!” And all Israel stoned Achan and his family to death. Then they burned the bodies and piled stones over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made such a large pile of stones over Achan that it is still there today. Then Yahweh withdrew his burning anger. For this reason that place is still called the valley of Achor today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Joshua, “Don’t be terrified or afraid. Take all the troops with you, and march against Ai. I am about to hand the king of Ai, his people, city, and land over to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will do the same thing to Ai and its king that you did to Jericho and its king. However, you may take its loot and livestock for yourselves. Set an ambush behind the city.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua and all the soldiers started to march against Ai. Joshua picked 30,000 of his best soldiers and sent them out at night
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with these orders: “Set an ambush behind the city. Don’t go very far away from the city. Everyone must be ready.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll approach the city with the rest of the troops. When they come out to attack us as they did the first time, we will run away from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They’ll come out after us, and we will lure them away from the city. They’ll say, ‘They’re running away from us just like the first time.’ As we run away from them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you come out of hiding and capture the city. Yahweh your Elohim will hand it over to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you have captured the city, set it on fire. Do what Yahweh says. These are your orders.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua sent them out, and they hid. They took their position west of Ai, between Bethel and Ai. Joshua spent the night with the troops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua got up early in the morning and assembled the troops. Then he and the leaders of Israel led the army to Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the troops with him marched until they were near the city. They camped north of Ai with the ravine between them and Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua had taken about five thousand men and had them hide between Bethel and Ai, west of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the troops were positioned. The main camp was north of the city, and the other troops were hiding west of the city. That night Joshua went down into the middle of the valley.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the king of Ai saw the main camp, he and all his troops got up early in the morning. They rushed out toward the plains to meet Israel for battle, just where Joshua expected. However, the king didn’t know there were troops behind the city waiting to attack him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua and all Israel pretended to be defeated. They ran away toward the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the troops in the city were called out to chase them. As they chased Joshua, they were lured away from the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not one man was left in Ai or Bethel; they all went after Israel. So the city was left unprotected as they chased Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh said to Joshua, “Hold out the spear in your hand toward the city, because I am handing Ai over to you.” So Joshua held out his spear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men who were hiding got up as soon as he stretched out his hand. They entered the city, captured it, and quickly set it on fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the men of Ai looked back, they could see the city going up in smoke. They had no place to go, since the Israelites, who had been running toward the desert, had now turned back on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joshua and all Israel saw that the men who had been hiding had captured the city and that it was going up in smoke, they turned and attacked the men of Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men who had captured the city also came out and attacked them. The men of Ai were caught between the battle lines of Israel. So Israel attacked them on both sides. None of them survived or escaped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they captured the king of Ai alive and brought him to Joshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel had finished killing all the inhabitants of Ai in the fields and in the desert where they had been pursued. They put them all to death; not one person survived. Then the Israelites went back to Ai and killed everyone left there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Twelve thousand men and women from Ai died that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua did not lower his hand holding the spear until he had completely destroyed all the inhabitants of Ai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel took the loot and the livestock of that city for themselves, as Yahweh had commanded Joshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua burned Ai and made it a deserted mound of ruins. It is still in ruins today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua hung the king of Ai’s dead body on a pole and left him there until evening. When the sun went down, Joshua gave the order to take his body down. They threw it in the entrance of the city and made a large pile of stones over it. That pile is still there today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Joshua built an altar on Mount Ebal to Yahweh Elohim of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He built an altar with uncut stones on which no iron chisels had been used. This was as Yahweh’s servant Moses had commanded the people of Israel in the Book of Moses’ Teachings. They made burnt offerings to Yahweh and sacrificed fellowship offerings on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There in front of the people of Israel he wrote on stone slabs a copy of the Teachings which Moses had written down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people of Israel, whether foreigners or native Israelites, the leaders, officers, and judges were standing on opposite sides of the ark. They faced the Levitical priests who carried the ark of Yahweh’s promise. Half of the people were in front of Mount Gerizim and the other half in front of Mount Ebal. Right from the beginning, Yahweh’s servant Moses had commanded the priests to bless the people of Israel this way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterwards, Joshua read all the Teachings—the blessings and curses—as they had all been written down by Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua read Moses’ Teachings in front of the whole assembly of Israel, including women, children, and foreigners living among them. He did not leave out one word from everything Moses had commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the kings west of the Jordan River heard about these events,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they joined together to fight Joshua and Israel. (They were the kings in the mountains, the foothills, and along the whole Mediterranean coast as far as Lebanon, the kings of the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people living in Gibeon heard what Joshua had done to Jericho and Ai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they devised a scheme. They posed as messengers. They took worn-out sacks on their donkeys. Their wineskins were old, split, and patched.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their sandals were worn-out and repaired, and their clothes were tattered. All their bread was dried out and crumbling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Joshua in the camp at Gilgal. They told Joshua and the men of Israel, “We have come from a distant country. Make a treaty with us right now.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Israel said to the Hivites, “What if you’re living in this area? We wouldn’t be able to make a treaty with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They responded to Joshua, “We’re at your mercy.”
Joshua asked them, “Who are you, and where did you come from?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered him, “We came from a country very far away because Yahweh your Elohim has become famous. We heard stories about him and everything he did in Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We also heard everything he did to the two kings of the Amorites east of the Jordan, King Sihon of Heshbon and King Og of Bashan in Ashtaroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our leaders and everyone who lives in our country told us, ‘Take what you need for the trip, and go meet them. Tell them, “We’re at your mercy. Make a treaty with us right now.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our bread was warm when we left home to meet with you. Look at it now! It’s dry and crumbling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were new wineskins when we filled them. Look at them now! See how they are splitting! Our clothes and sandals are also worn-out because we have come such a long way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men believed the evidence they were shown, but they did not ask Yahweh about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua made peace with them by making a treaty which allowed them to live. The leaders of the congregation swore to it with an oath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But three days after the treaty was made, the Israelites heard that these people were their neighbors and lived with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelites broke camp. They came to the cities of Gibeon, Chephirah, Beeroth, and Kiriath Jearim two days later.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelites didn’t destroy these other people, because the leaders of the congregation had sworn an oath about them to Yahweh Elohim of Israel. The whole congregation complained about the leaders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all the leaders said to them, “We have sworn an oath about them to Yahweh Elohim of Israel, so we cannot touch them now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We must let them live to avoid the Lord’s anger because of the oath we swore.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leaders said that they should be allowed to live. So they became woodcutters and water carriers for the whole congregation, as the leaders had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua sent for the people of Gibeon and asked, “Why did you deceive us by saying, ‘We live very far away from you,’ when you live here with us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are under a curse now. You will always be servants. You will be woodcutters and water carriers for the house of my Elohim.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered Joshua, “We were told that Yahweh your Elohim commanded his servant Moses to give you the whole land and destroy all who live there. We deceived you because we feared for our lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we’re at your mercy. Do to us what you think is good and right.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua rescued them and did not let the people of Israel kill them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that day Joshua made them woodcutters and water carriers for the congregation. They served Yahweh’s altar, wherever he chose to put it. They still serve today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Adoni Zedek of Jerusalem heard that Joshua had captured Ai and claimed it for the Lord the same way he had destroyed Jericho and its king. He also heard that the people of Gibeon had made peace with the people of Israel and were living with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He and his people were terribly afraid because Gibeon was a large city. It was like one of the royal cities, larger than Ai. All its men were warriors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So King Adoni Zedek of Jerusalem sent this message to King Hoham of Hebron, King Piram of Jarmuth, King Japhia of Lachish, and King Debir of Eglon:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Come, help me destroy Gibeon because it has made peace with Joshua and the people of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the five Amorite kings of Jerusalem, Hebron, Jarmuth, Lachish, and Eglon combined their armies. They marched to Gibeon, camped there, and attacked it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Gibeon sent this message to Joshua at the camp in Gilgal: “Don’t abandon us! Come quickly, and save us. Help us because all the Amorite kings who live in the mountains have united against us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua, with all his soldiers and best warriors, set out from Gilgal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh told Joshua, “Don’t be afraid of them. I have handed them over to you. None of them can stand up to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua marched all night from Gilgal and took them by surprise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord threw the enemy into disorder in front of Israel and defeated them decisively at Gibeon. He chased them along the road that goes to the slope of Beth Horon and continued to defeat them all the way to Azekah and Makkedah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they fled from the Israelites down the slope of Beth Horon toward Azekah, Yahweh threw huge hailstones on them. More died from the hailstones than from Israelite swords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The day Yahweh handed the Amorites over to the people of Israel, Joshua spoke to Yahweh while Israel was watching,
“Sun, stand still over Gibeon,
    and moon, stand still over the valley of Aijalon!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun stood still,
    and the moon stopped
        until a nation got revenge on its enemies.
Isn’t this recorded in the Book of Jashar? The sun stopped in the middle of the sky, and for nearly a day the sun was in no hurry to set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never before or after this day was there anything like it. Yahweh did what a man told him to do, because Yahweh fought for Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua and all Israel returned to the camp at Gilgal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The five kings ran away and hid in the cave at Makkedah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Someone told Joshua, “The five kings have been found. They are hiding in the cave at Makkedah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua replied, “Roll large stones against the mouth of the cave, and post a guard there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But don’t stop. Chase your enemies! Cut off their rear guard. Don’t let them get back into their own cities, because Yahweh your Elohim has handed them over to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua and the Israelites defeated them decisively, almost destroying them. But some who survived got back into the fortified cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the whole army returned safely to Joshua in the camp at Makkedah. Not a single person dared to speak against any of the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said, “Open the cave, and bring me the five kings!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they brought him the kings of Jerusalem, Hebron, Jarmuth, Lachish, and Eglon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they brought them to Joshua, he called for all the men of Israel. He told the officers who had gone with him, “Come forward and put your feet on the necks of these kings.” So that’s what they did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua told them, “Don’t be afraid or terrified! Be strong and courageous, because this is what Yahweh will do to all the enemies you’re fighting against.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Joshua put them to death and hung their bodies on five poles until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sun went down, Joshua gave the order to take them down from the poles. Then they threw them into the cave where they had been hiding and put large stones over the mouth of the cave. These stones are still there today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That same day Joshua captured Makkedah, and the Israelites killed its people and king with swords. He claimed them for the Lord by destroying them. There were no survivors. He did the same thing to the king of Makkedah that he had done to the king of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua and all Israel marched from Makkedah to Libnah and attacked it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh also handed Libnah and its king over to Israel. He killed all the people. There were no survivors. He did the same thing to the king of Libnah that he had done to the king of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua and all Israel marched from Libnah to Lachish, camped there, and attacked it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh handed Lachish over to Israel. He captured it on the next day and killed all the people, the same way he had captured Libnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time King Horam of Gezer had come to help Lachish. But Joshua killed him and his troops. There were no survivors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua and all Israel marched from Lachish to Eglon, camped there, and attacked it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They captured it that day and killed everyone in it. He claimed it for the Lord by destroying it the same way he had destroyed Lachish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua and all Israel marched from Eglon to Hebron and attacked it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They captured it and its neighboring villages and killed its king and all the people. There were no survivors, the same as at Eglon. He claimed the city and all its people for the Lord by destroying them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua and all Israel went back to Debir and attacked it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He captured it and its king and all its neighboring villages and killed everyone. So they claimed them all for the Lord by destroying them. There were no survivors. He did the same thing to Debir and its king that he had done to Hebron and Libnah and their kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua captured the whole land—the mountains, the Negev, the foothills, and the slopes. There were no survivors. He claimed every living creature for the Lord by destroying it, as Yahweh Elohim of Israel had commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua defeated the people from Kadesh Barnea to Gaza and from all the country of Goshen as far as Gibeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua captured all these kings and their territories in one campaign because Yahweh Elohim of Israel fought for Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua and all Israel returned to the camp at Gilgal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Jabin of Hazor heard what had happened. So he sent messengers to King Jobab of Madon and to the kings of Shimron and Achshaph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also sent messengers to the northern kings in the mountains, the plains south of Chinneroth, the foothills, and Naphoth Dor in the west,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Canaanites from east and west, the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, the Jebusites in the mountains, and the Hivites at the foot of Mount Hermon in Mizpah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came out with all their armies. Their troops were as numerous as the grains of sand on the seashore. They also had horses and chariots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these kings camped together by the Springs of Merom in order to fight Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh told Joshua, “Don’t be afraid of them because I am going to give them to Israel. About this time tomorrow they will all be dead. You must disable their horses so that they cannot be used in battle. You must burn their chariots.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua and all his troops arrived suddenly at the Springs of Merom and attacked the Canaanite armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh handed them over to Israel, and the Israelites defeated them. The Israelites chased them as far as Great Sidon, Misrephoth Maim, and the valley of Mizpah in the east. There were no survivors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua disabled their horses and burned their chariots, as Yahweh had told him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua turned back and captured Hazor. He killed its king with a sword. (Hazor was formerly the head of all these kingdoms.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They claimed everyone for the Lord by destroying them with swords. Not one person survived. Joshua also burned Hazor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua captured all these cities and their kings. He claimed them for the Lord by destroying them, as Yahweh’s servant Moses had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel did not burn cities built on mounds. However, Joshua made an exception and burned Hazor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Israel took all the loot and livestock from these cities. But they put everyone to death until they were all destroyed. Not one person survived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua carried out what Yahweh had commanded his servant Moses and what Moses had commanded him. He did not leave out anything Yahweh had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua took all this land, the mountains, all the Negev, all the land of Goshen, the foothills, the plains, and the mountains and foothills of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land extended from Mount Halak which ascends to Seir as far as Baal Gad in the Lebanon Valley at the foot of Mount Hermon. He captured all their kings and killed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua waged war with all these kings for a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not one city had made a peace treaty with the people of Israel except Gibeon, where the Hivites lived. Israel captured everything in battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh made their enemies stubborn enough to continue fighting against Israel so that he could claim them all for destruction without mercy, as Yahweh had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Joshua also wiped out the people of Anak in the mountains, in Hebron, Debir, and Anab, and in all the hills of Judah and Israel. Joshua claimed them for the Lord by destroying them and their cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of the people of Anak remained in Israel. Some of them were left in Gaza, Gath, and Ashdod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua captured the whole land as Yahweh had promised Moses. He gave it to Israel as a possession, dividing it among the tribes. So the land had peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the kings of the land east of the Jordan River that the people of Israel defeated. Israel also took possession of their lands from the Arnon Valley to Mount Hermon, and all the eastern plains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sihon was the Amorite king who lived in Heshbon. His rule extended from Aroer on the edge of the Arnon Valley to the Jabbok River, which is the border of Ammon. This included the middle of the valley and half of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It included the eastern plains from the Sea of Galilee to the Sea of the Plains (the Dead Sea) and the road that goes south from Beth Jeshimoth to the foot of the slopes of Pisgah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The territory of King Og of Bashan who lived in Ashtaroth and Edrei was captured. He was the last of the Rephaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He ruled Mount Hermon, Salecah, all of Bashan to the border of Geshur and Maacath, and half of Gilead to the border of King Sihon of Heshbon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s servant Moses and the people of Israel defeated them. Then he gave their land as a possession to the tribes of Reuben and Gad and half of the tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the kings of the land west of the Jordan River that Joshua and the people of Israel defeated. Their lands extended from Baal Gad in the valley of Lebanon to Mount Halak which rises toward Seir. Joshua gave it as a possession to Israel, dividing it among the tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It included the mountains, foothills, plains, slopes, desert, and the Negev that the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites had possessed.
The kings were
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Jericho, the king of Ai (near Bethel),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Eglon, the king of Gezer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Debir, the king of Geder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Hormah, the king of Arad,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Libnah, the king of Adullam,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Makkedah, the king of Bethel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Tappuah, the king of Hepher,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Aphek, the king of Sharon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Madon, the king of Hazor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Shimron Meron, the king of Achshaph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Taanach, the king of Megiddo,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Kedesh, the king of Jokneam in Carmel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the king of Dor in Naphoth Dor, the king of Goiim in Gilgal,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the king of Tirzah.
The total was 31 kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua was old, near the end of his life. So Yahweh said to him, “You are old, near the end of your life, and there is a lot of land left to be conquered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land that is left includes all the districts that belong to the Philistines and Geshur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It extends from the Shihor River, east of Egypt, northward as far as the border of Ekron. This is considered to be Canaanite territory, even though there are five Philistine rulers over Gaza, Ashdod, Ashkelon, Gath, and Ekron, as well as the Avvim people
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the south. This territory includes all the land of the Canaanites as well as Mearah which belongs to Sidon as far as Aphek, the Amorite border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It also includes the land of the people of Gebal, all Lebanon eastward from Baal Gad at the foot of Mount Hermon to the border of Hamath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will force out of the way of the people of Israel everyone who lives in the mountains from Lebanon to Misrephoth Maim and all the people of Sidon. However, you must distribute the land as an inheritance to Israel by drawing lots, as I commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So divide this land. It will be an inheritance for the nine tribes and half of the tribe of Manasseh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tribes of Reuben and Gad with half of the tribe of Manasseh had received their inheritance east of the Jordan River, since Yahweh’s servant Moses had already given it to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border extended from Aroer on the edge of the Arnon Valley, including the city in the middle of the valley, and the whole plateau from Medeba to Dibon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It included all the cities of King Sihon of the Amorites up to the border of Ammon. Sihon’s capital was Heshbon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It also included Gilead, the territory of the people of Geshur and Maacath, all of Mount Hermon, and all of Bashan as far as Salecah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (the whole kingdom of Og in Bashan). Og ruled in Ashtaroth and Edrei. He was the last of the Rephaim. Moses had defeated them and forced them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Israelites did not force out the people of Geshur and Maacath. So they still live in Israel today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses did not give any land as an inheritance to the tribe of Levi. The sacrifices offered to Yahweh Elohim of Israel are what the Levites inherited, as Yahweh had promised them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses gave some land as an inheritance to the tribe of Reuben for their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their territory extended from Aroer on the edge of the Arnon Valley, including the city in the middle of the valley and the whole plateau near Medeba.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It included Heshbon and all its cities on the plateau, Dibon, Bamoth Baal, Beth Baal Meon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jahaz, Kedemoth, Mephaath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kiriathaim, Sibmah, Zereth Shahar on the mountain in the valley,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beth Peor, the slopes of Pisgah, and Beth Jeshimoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It also included all the cities of the plateau, the whole kingdom of King Sihon of the Amorites, who ruled in Heshbon. Moses defeated him and Midian’s leaders—Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba. They were princes of Sihon, who lived in that country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Along with these leaders, the people of Israel also killed Balaam, son of Beor, who used black magic.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border of Reuben’s territory was the Jordan River. This was Reuben’s inheritance for its families. It included cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses gave some land as an inheritance to the tribe of Gad for its families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their territory included Jazer, all the cities of Gilead, and half of Ammon as far as Aroer, which is by Rabbah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It extended from Heshbon to Ramath Mizpeh and Betonim, and from Mahanaim as far as the border of Lidbir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the Jordan Valley it included Beth Haram, Beth Nimrah, Succoth, and Zaphon, the rest of the kingdom of King Sihon of Heshbon. The Jordan River served as its western border, extending to the end of the Sea of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was Gad’s inheritance for its families. It included cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses gave some land as an inheritance to half of the tribe of Manasseh. It was only for the families of that half of the tribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their territory extended from Mahanaim and included all of Bashan (the whole kingdom of King Og of Bashan) and all 60 settlements of Jair that were in Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It also included half of Gilead with Ashtaroth and Edrei, the royal cities of Og in Bashan. They were given to half the families of Machir, son of Manasseh, for their inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the land that Moses distributed on Moab’s plains, east of the Jordan River near Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses did not give any land as an inheritance to the tribe of Levi. Yahweh Elohim of Israel is what they inherited, as he had promised them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the land that the people of Israel inherited in Canaan. The priest Eleazar, Joshua (son of Nun), and the heads of Israel’s tribes distributed it to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land inherited by the nine-and-a-half tribes was determined by drawing lots as Yahweh had commanded through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses had given the two-and-a-half tribes their inheritance east of the Jordan River. He did not give any land as an inheritance to Levi’s tribe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because Joseph’s descendants, Manasseh and Ephraim, formed two tribes. The Levites were not given a share of the land. Joseph’s descendants gave the Levites cities to live in with pasturelands for their cattle and everything they had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people of Israel divided the land as Yahweh had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people of Judah came to Joshua at Gilgal. Caleb, son of Jephunneh and grandson of Kenaz, said to him, “You know what Yahweh said to Moses, the man of Elohim, at Kadesh Barnea about you and me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was 40 years old when Yahweh’s servant Moses sent me from Kadesh Barnea to explore the land. I reported to him exactly what I thought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But my companions discouraged the people. However, I was completely loyal to Yahweh my Elohim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day Moses swore this oath: ‘The land your feet walked on will be a permanent inheritance for you and your descendants because you were completely loyal to Yahweh my Elohim.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So look at me. Yahweh has kept me alive as he promised. It’s been 45 years since Israel wandered in the desert when Yahweh made this promise to Moses. So now look at me today. I’m 85 years old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m still as fit to go to war now as I was when Moses sent me out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now give me this mountain region which Yahweh spoke of that day. You heard that the people of Anak are still there and that they have large, fortified cities. If Yahweh is with me, I can force them out, as Yahweh promised.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua blessed Caleb, son of Jephunneh, and gave him Hebron as his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hebron is still the inheritance of Caleb, son of Jephunneh and grandson of Kenaz, because Caleb was completely loyal to Yahweh Elohim of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the past Hebron was called Kiriath Arba. Arba was the greatest man among the people of Anak. So the land had peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lot was drawn for the families of the tribe of Judah. Their territory extends as far south as the territory of Edom and the desert of Zin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The southern border starts from the south end of the Dead Sea
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and goes south of the Akrabbim Pass. It then passes Zin and goes up south of Kadesh Barnea. From there it goes to Hezron, up to Addar, around to Karka,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on to Azmon. It comes out at the River of Egypt so that the border ends at the Mediterranean Sea. This is the southern border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eastern border is the Dead Sea as far north as the mouth of the Jordan River.
The northern border starts from the north end of the Dead Sea at the mouth of the Jordan
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and goes up to Beth Hoglah. It then passes north to Beth Arabah and goes up to the Rock of Bohan, son of Reuben.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the valley of Achor, the border goes up to Debir and turns north to the region that faces the Adummim Pass, south of the valley. Then the border passes the Springs of En Shemesh and ends at En Rogel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It continues up the valley of Ben Hinnom to the south slope of the Jebusite city Jerusalem. It then goes to the top of the mountain that overlooks the valley of Hinnom to the west at the north end of the valley of Rephaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the top of that mountain the border goes around to the spring of Nephtoah. From there it goes to the cities of Mount Ephron and around to Baalah (now called Kiriath Jearim).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Baalah the border turns west to Mount Seir and over to the north slope of Mount Jearim (now called Chesalon). Then it goes down to Beth Shemesh and on to Timnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there the border goes on the north side of Ekron and turns to Shikkeron, on to Mount Baalah, and comes out at Jabneel. The border ends at the Mediterranean Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The western border is the coastline of the Mediterranean Sea. These are the borders around Judah that belong to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua gave Caleb, son of Jephunneh, a share of land among the people of Judah as Yahweh had told them. It was Kiriath Arba (now called Hebron). Arba was the father of Anak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Caleb forced out Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai, three descendants of Anak from Hebron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there he marched against the people living in Debir. (In the past Debir was called Kiriath Sepher.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Caleb said, “I will give my daughter Achsah as a wife to anyone who attacks Kiriath Sepher and captures it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Othniel, son of Caleb’s brother Kenaz, captured it. So Caleb gave him his daughter Achsah as a wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she came to Othniel, she persuaded him to ask her father for a field. When she got down from her donkey, Caleb asked her, “What do you want?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She answered, “Give me a blessing. Since you’ve given me some dry land, also give me some springs.” So Caleb gave her the upper and lower springs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the land inherited by the families of the tribe of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the farthest edge of the Negev, on the border of Edom, they gave the tribe of Judah 29 cities with their villages: Kabzeel, Eder, Jagur,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kinah, Dimonah, Adadah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kedesh, Hazor, Ithnan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ziph, Telem, Bealoth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hazor Hadattah, Kerioth Hezron (now called Hazor),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amam, Shema, Moladah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hazar Gaddah, Heshmon, Beth Pelet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hazar Shual, Beersheba, Biziothiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Baalah, Iim, Ezem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eltolad, Chesil, Hormah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ziklag, Madmannah, Sansannah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lebaoth, Shilhim, Ain, and Rimmon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the foothills they gave Judah 14 cities with their villages: Eshtaol, Zorah, Ashnah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zanoah, En Gannim, Tappuah, Enam,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jarmuth, Adullam, Socoh, Azekah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shaaraim, Adithaim, Gederah, and Gederothaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also gave Judah 16 other cities with their villages: Zenan, Hadashah, Migdalgad,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dilean, Mizpah, Joktheel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lachish, Bozkath, Eglon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cabbon, Lahmas, Chitlish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gederoth, Beth Dagon, Naamah, and Makkedah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An additional nine cities with their villages were given to Judah: Libnah, Ether, Ashan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Iphtah, Ashnah, Nezib,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keilah, Achzib, and Mareshah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah also received Ekron with its cities and villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This included all the cities with their villages between Ekron and the Mediterranean Sea and alongside Ashdod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Added to this were Ashdod and Gaza with their cities and villages as far as the River of Egypt and the coast of the Mediterranean Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the mountains they gave Judah 11 cities with their villages: Shamir, Jattir, Socoh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dannah, Kiriath Sannah (now called Debir),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anab, Eshtemoh, Anim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Goshen, Holon, and Giloh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also gave Judah nine other cities with their villages: Arab, Dumah, Eshan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Janim, Beth Tappuah, Aphekah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Humtah, Kiriath Arba (now called Hebron), and Zior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also received another ten cities with their villages: Maon, Carmel, Ziph, Juttah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jezreel, Jokdeam, Zanoah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kain, Gibeah, and Timnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Halhul, Bethzur, Gedor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Maarath, Bethanoth, and Eltekon were six other cities with their villages that were given to Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two cities of Kiriath Baal (now called Kiriath Jearim) and Rabbah with their villages were given to Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the desert Judah was given six cities with their villages: Beth Arabah, Middin, Secacah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nibshan, Ir Hamelah, and En Gedi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, Judah was not able to force out the people of Jebus who lived in Jerusalem. So they still live with Judah in Jerusalem today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lot was drawn for Joseph. The border of Joseph’s territory goes from the Jordan River at Jericho to the springs of Jericho on the east, through the desert that goes up from Jericho, and through the mountains to Bethel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Bethel the border goes to Luz and over to Ataroth at the border of the Archites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it descends west to the border of Japhlet and Lower Beth Horon, on to Gezer, and ends at the Mediterranean Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph’s sons, Manasseh and Ephraim, received this land as their inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the territory for the families descended from Ephraim. The eastern border of the land they inherited is from Ataroth Addar to Upper Beth Horon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there the border goes west, with Michmethath on the north. The border then turns east to Taanath Shiloh and passes east to Janoah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Janoah it descends to Ataroth and Naarah, touches Jericho, and ends at the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At Tappuah the border goes west along the Kanah River and ends at the Mediterranean Sea. This is the land given as an inheritance to the families of the tribe of Ephraim
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with all the cities and their villages selected for Ephraim in Manasseh’s territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, they did not force out the Canaanites who lived in Gezer. So the Canaanites still live in Ephraim today, but they are required to do forced labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lot was drawn for the tribe of Manasseh, because Manasseh was Joseph’s firstborn. Machir, Manasseh’s firstborn, the ancestor of the people living in Gilead, had received Gilead and Bashan because he was a soldier.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land was given to the rest of the families descended from Manasseh, to the descendants of Abiezer, Helek, Asriel, Shechem, Hepher, and Shemida. These were the male descendants of Joseph’s son Manasseh listed by their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zelophehad, son of Hepher, grandson of Gilead, and great-grandson of Machir, whose father was Manasseh, had no sons—only daughters. Their names were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to the priest Eleazar, Joshua (son of Nun), and the leaders. They said, “Yahweh commanded Moses to give us some land as an inheritance among our male relatives.” So they gave them an inheritance among their father’s relatives as Yahweh had required.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ten portions of land went to Manasseh, besides the land of Gilead and Bashan east of the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These portions were distributed because Manasseh’s daughters were given an inheritance along with his sons, while Gilead belonged to Manasseh’s other descendants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Manasseh’s border extends from Asher to Michmethath, which faces Shechem. Then the border goes south toward the people who live in En Tappuah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (The land of Tappuah belongs to Manasseh, but Tappuah itself, on the border of Manasseh, belongs to Ephraim.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border then descends southward to the Kanah River. These cities belong to Ephraim, although they are among Manasseh’s cities. Manasseh’s southern border is the river, which ends at the Mediterranean Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is south of the river belongs to Ephraim, and what is north of it belongs to Manasseh. So the Mediterranean Sea is its western border, Asher its northern border, and Issachar its eastern border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Issachar and Asher, Manasseh possessed Beth Shean and Ibleam with their villages and the people living in Dor, En Dor, Taanach, and Megiddo and their villages. The last three are on mountain ridges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Manasseh was not able to take possession of these cities since the Canaanites were determined to stay in this land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Israelites became strong enough, they made the Canaanites do forced labor, since they didn’t force all of them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph’s descendants asked Joshua, “Why did you give us only one region for an inheritance? We have a lot of people because Yahweh has blessed us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua replied, “If there are so many of you, go into the forest! Clear ground for yourselves there in the land of the Perizzites and Rephaim if the mountains of Ephraim are too confining for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph’s descendants responded, “The mountains are not enough for us either. Besides, all the Canaanites living in the valley, in Beth Shean and its villages, and in the valley of Jezreel have chariots made of iron.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua said to the descendants of Joseph, the tribes of Ephraim and Manasseh, “You are an important and very powerful people. One region is really not enough for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The mountain region will be yours as well. It is a forest, so you will have to clear it. All of it will be yours. But you must force out the Canaanites, even though they are strong and have chariots made of iron.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole congregation of Israel gathered at Shiloh and set up the tent of meeting there. The land was under their control.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were still seven tribes in Israel who had not yet received any land as their inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua asked the Israelites, “How long are you going to waste time conquering the land which Yahweh Elohim of your ancestors has given you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Choose three men from each tribe, and I will send them out. They will survey the land and write a description of it which shows the borders of their inheritance. Then they will come back to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will divide the land into seven parts. Judah will stay within its territory in the south, and Joseph’s descendants will stay within their territory in the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must describe the seven parts of the land and report to me here. I will draw lots for you here in the presence of Yahweh our Elohim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Levi’s tribe has no separate region among you, because their inheritance is to serve the Lord as priests. The tribes of Gad and Reuben and half of the tribe of Manasseh have received the inheritance that Yahweh’s servant Moses gave them on the east side of the Jordan River.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the men got ready to go, Joshua ordered them to write a description of the land. He said, “Go survey the land. Write a description of it, and return to me. Then I will draw lots for you in the presence of Yahweh here in Shiloh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men surveyed the land. They described it in a book. The land was divided into seven parts according to its cities. Then they returned to Joshua at the camp at Shiloh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua drew lots for them in the presence of Yahweh in Shiloh. There Joshua divided the land among the tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lot was drawn for the families of the tribe of Benjamin. Their territory lies between Judah’s and Joseph’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their northern border starts at the Jordan, goes up the slope north of Jericho, west through the mountains, and ends at the desert of Beth Aven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there the border goes to the south slope of Luz (now called Bethel). Then the border goes down to Ataroth Addar over the mountains south of Lower Beth Horon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border turns and goes around on the west side, south of the mountain that faces Beth Horon, and ends at Kiriath Baal (now called Kiriath Jearim), a city of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The southern border begins just outside Kiriath Jearim and goes west, to the springs of Nephtoah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the border descends to the foot of the mountain that overlooks the valley of Ben Hinnom, in the north end of the valley of Rephaim. It descends to the valley of Hinnom, to the south slope of the city of Jebus, and down to En Rogel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it turns north and goes to En Shemesh and from there to the region opposite the Adummim Pass. It descends to the Rock of Bohan, son of Reuben.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it continues on to the north side of the slope facing the plains and down into the plains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border continues to the north slope of Beth Hoglah and ends at the northern bay of the Dead Sea at the south end of the Jordan River. This is its southern border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jordan River is its eastern border. These are the borders surrounding the inheritance given to Benjamin for its families.
