verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the 12 cities with their villages that belong to the tribe of Benjamin for its families: Jericho, Beth Hoglah, Emek Keziz,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beth Arabah, Zemaraim, Bethel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Avvim, Parah, Ophrah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Chephar Ammoni, Ophni, and Geba.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were 14 other cities with their villages: Gibeon, Ramah, Beeroth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mizpeh, Chephirah, Mozah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rekem, Ir Peel, Taralah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zela, Eleph, Jebus (now called Jerusalem), Gibeath, and Kiriath. This is Benjamin’s inheritance for its families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second lot was drawn for the families of the tribe of Simeon. Their inheritance was within Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In their inheritance they received 13 cities and their villages: Beersheba (Sheba), Moladah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hazar Shual, Balah, Ezem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eltolad, Bethul, Hormah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ziklag, Beth Marcaboth, Hazar Susah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beth Lebaoth, and Sharuhen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were four other cities with their villages: Ain, Rimmon, Ether, and Ashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the villages around these cities as far as Baalath Beer and Ramath Negev were also included. This is the inheritance of the tribe of Simeon for its families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simeon’s inheritance was a part of Judah’s because Judah had more land than it needed. So Simeon received its inheritance inside Judah’s borders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The third lot was drawn for the families descended from Zebulun. The border of their inheritance goes as far as Sarid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Toward the west the border ascends to Maralah and touches Dabbesheth and the river near Jokneam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But from Sarid it turns directly east toward the border of Chisloth Tabor, on to Daberath, and then ascends toward Japhia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there it goes directly east to Gath Hepher, Eth Kazin, and Rimmon, where it turns to Neah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There the border turns north to Hannathon and ends at the valley of Iphtah El.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This also includes Kattath, Nahalal, Shimron, Idalah, and Bethlehem. There were 12 cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These cities with their villages are the inheritance given to the families descended from Zebulun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fourth lot was drawn for the families descended from Issachar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their territory included Jezreel, Chesulloth, Shunem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hapharaim, Shion, Anaharath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rabbith, Kishion, Ebez,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remeth, En Gannim, En Haddah, and Beth Pazzez.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border touches Tabor, Shahazimah, and Beth Shemesh and ends at the Jordan River. There were 16 cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These cities with their villages are the inheritance for the families of the tribe of Issachar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifth lot was drawn for the families of the tribe of Asher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their territory included Helkath, Hali, Beten, Achshaph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Allammelech, Amad, and Mishal. The border touches Carmel and Shihor Libnath in the west.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it turns east to Beth Dagon and touches Zebulun and the valley of Iphtah El in the north and goes to Beth Emek and Neiel. From there it goes northward to Cabul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abdon, Rehob, Hammon, Kanah, and as far as Great Sidon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it turns at Ramah and goes on to the fortified city of Tyre. The border then turns to Hosah and ends at the Mediterranean Sea. The territory includes Meheleb, Achzib,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Umma, Acco, Aphek, and Rehob. There were 22 cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These cities with their villages are the inheritance for the families of the tribe of Asher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sixth lot was drawn for the families descended from the tribe of Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their border starts from Heleph at the oak tree at Zaanannim. It continues to Adami Nekeb, Jabneel, to Lakkum, and ends at the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border turns west to Aznoth Tabor, and from there to Hukok. It touches Zebulun in the south, Asher in the west, and Judah in the east at the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fortified cities were Ziddim, Zer, Hammath, Rakkath, Chinnereth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adamah, Ramah, Hazor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kedesh, Edrei, En Hazor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yiron, Migdal El, Horem, Beth Anath, and Beth Shemeth. There were 19 cities with their villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These cities with their villages are the inheritance for the families of the tribe of Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh lot was drawn for the families of the tribe of Dan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The territory of their inheritance included Zorah, Eshtaol, Ir Shemesh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shaalabbin, Aijalon, Ithlah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elon, Timnah, Ekron,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eltekeh, Gibbethon, Baalath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehud, Bene Berak, Gath Rimmon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Me Jarkon, and Rakkon, with the border passing in front of Joppa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border of Dan extended beyond them. Dan’s descendants went up and attacked Leshem, captured it, and killed everyone there. They took it, settled there, and renamed the city Dan after their ancestor Dan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These cities with their villages are the inheritance for the families of the tribe of Dan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they all had finally received the land they were to inherit, the people of Israel also gave land within their territory as an inheritance to Joshua, son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave him the city he asked for, as Yahweh had instructed them to do. It was Timnath Serah in the mountains of Ephraim. He rebuilt the city and lived there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the land that the tribes of Israel drew by lot. The priest Eleazar, Joshua son of Nun, and the leaders of the families divided the land by drawing lots. They did this in Shiloh in the presence of Yahweh at the entrance of the tent of meeting. So they finished dividing the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Joshua,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell the people of Israel, ‘Now choose for yourselves the cities of refuge about which I spoke to you through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Choose them so that anyone who unintentionally kills someone may run to them. They will be a place of refuge from any relative who can avenge the death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘A person who kills someone accidentally can run to one of these cities. There he will stand at the entrance to the city, where court is held, and present his case to the leaders of that city. Then they will take him into their city and give him a place to live with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘If the relative who can avenge the death pursues him, the leaders must not hand him over to the relative because he didn’t intend to kill the other person. He didn’t even hate the person he killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The accused person may remain in that city until he can stand trial in front of the congregation or until whoever is chief priest at that time dies. Then he may go back to his home in the city from which he ran away.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kedesh in Galilee in the mountains of Naphtali, Shechem in the mountains of Ephraim, and Kiriath Arba (now called Hebron) in the mountains of Judah were chosen as cities of refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bezer on the desert plateau from the tribe of Reuben, Ramoth in Gilead from the tribe of Gad, and Golan in Bashan from the tribe of Manasseh were chosen as cities of refuge on the east side of the Jordan River, east of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the cities chosen as cities of refuge for all Israelites, including the foreigners living among them. Anyone who accidentally kills someone may escape to these cities. Then he will not be handed over to the relative who can avenge a death before he stands trial in front of the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the leaders of the families of Levi came to the priest Eleazar, to Joshua (son of Nun), and to the leaders of the families of the other Israelite tribes
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at Shiloh in Canaan. They said to them, “Yahweh commanded through Moses that we should receive cities to live in and pasturelands for our livestock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, as Yahweh had instructed, Levi’s descendants were given the following cities with pasturelands from the Israelites’ inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the cities for the families of Kohath that were chosen by drawing lots. These descendants of the priest Aaron the Levite received 13 cities from the tribes of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of Kohath’s descendants received 10 cities from the families of the tribes of Ephraim and Dan and half of the tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gershon’s descendants received 13 cities from the families of the tribes of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and half of the tribe of Manasseh in Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Merari’s descendants received 12 cities for their families from the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Zebulun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelites gave these cities with pasturelands to Levi’s descendants by drawing lots, as Yahweh had commanded through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the cities from the tribes of Judah and Simeon
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that they gave Aaron’s descendants who were from the families of Kohath in the tribe of Levi. Their lot was the first one drawn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave them Kiriath Arba (Arba was Anak’s father) and the pastureland around it. This is the city of Hebron located in the mountains of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they gave its fields and villages to Caleb, son of Jephunneh, as his possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they gave the following cities with pasturelands to the descendants of Aaron, the priest. The nine cities from those two tribes were Hebron (a city of refuge for murderers), Libnah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jattir, Eshtemoa,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Holon, Debir,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ain, Juttah, and Beth Shemesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tribe of Benjamin also gave them four cities: Gibeon, Geba,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anathoth, and Almon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all, 13 cities with pasturelands were given to the priests, the descendants of Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cities were chosen by lot from the tribe of Ephraim to give to the rest of Levi’s descendants who were from the families of Kohath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These four cities with pasturelands were Shechem (a city of refuge for murderers) in the mountains of Ephraim, Gezer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kibzaim, and Beth Horon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tribe of Dan gave them four cities: Eltekeh, Gibbethon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aijalon, and Gath Rimmon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Half of the tribe of Manasseh gave them two cities with pasturelands: Taanach and Gath Rimmon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all, ten cities with pasturelands were given to the rest of the families of Kohath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave the families of Gershon’s descendants, who were in the tribe of Levi, two cities with pasturelands from half of the tribe of Manasseh: Golan in Bashan (a city of refuge for murderers) and Ashtaroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Four cities with pasturelands were also given to them from the tribe of Issachar: Kishion, Daberath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jarmuth, and En Gannim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another four cities with pasturelands were given to them from the tribe of Asher: Mishal, Abdon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Helkath, and Rehob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also three cities with pasturelands were given to them from the tribe of Naphtali: Kedesh in Galilee (a city of refuge for murderers), Hammoth Dor, and Kartan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all, 13 cities with pasturelands were given to Gershon’s families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the families of Merari, who were from the tribe of Levi, the tribe of Zebulun gave four cities with pasturelands: Jokneam, Kartah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dimnah, and Nahalal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tribe of Reuben also gave them four cities with pasturelands: Bezer, Jahaz,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kedemoth, and Mephaath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tribe of Gad also gave them four cities with pasturelands: Ramoth in Gilead (a city of refuge for murderers), Mahanaim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heshbon, and Jazer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these cities belonged to the families of Merari. They were the last of the families of Levi. These 12 cities were chosen by lot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Within the territory owned by the Israelites there were 48 cities in all for Levi’s descendants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of these cities had its own pastureland around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Yahweh gave Israel the whole land he had sworn to give their ancestors. They took possession of it and settled there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh allowed them to have peace on every side, as he had sworn with an oath to their ancestors. Not one of their enemies stood up to them. Yahweh handed all their enemies over to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every single good promise that Yahweh had given the nation of Israel came true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua summoned the tribes of Reuben and Gad and half of the tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “You have done everything Yahweh’s servant Moses commanded you. You have also obeyed me in everything I commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All this time, to this day, you have never deserted your relatives. You have carefully kept the commands of Yahweh your Elohim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now Yahweh your Elohim has given your relatives peace, as he promised them. So return home, to the land that is your own possession. It is the land that Yahweh’s servant Moses gave you east of the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Carefully follow the commands and teachings that Yahweh’s servant Moses gave you. Love Yahweh your Elohim, follow his directions, and keep his commands. Be loyal to him, and serve him with all your heart and soul.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua blessed them. He sent them on their way, and they went to their homes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses had given land in Bashan as an inheritance to half of Manasseh, and Joshua had given the other half of the tribe their land with their relatives west of the Jordan. When Joshua sent them home, he blessed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also said to them, “Return to your homes with your vast wealth, large herds of livestock, silver, gold, bronze, iron, and loads of clothing. Divide the loot from your enemies with your relatives.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the tribes of Reuben and Gad and half of the tribe of Manasseh left the rest of the Israelites at Shiloh in Canaan. They returned to Gilead. This was their own possession which they had captured as Yahweh had instructed them through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Reuben, Gad, and half of the tribe of Manasseh came to the region of the Jordan that was still in Canaan. They built an altar by the Jordan River. The altar was very large and highly visible.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of the Israelites heard about it and said, “See there! Reuben, Gad, and half of the tribe of Manasseh have built an altar at the border of Canaan. It’s in the region near the Jordan River on Israel’s side.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people of Israel heard about it, the whole congregation of Israel gathered at Shiloh. They intended to wage war against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelites sent Phinehas, son of the priest Eleazar, to the tribes of Reuben and Gad and half of the tribe of Manasseh in Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ten leaders, one from each tribe in Israel, went with him. Each man was a leader of a household and head of a family division in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they arrived these leaders said to the people of Gilead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “All of Yahweh’s congregation is asking, ‘What is this faithless act you have committed against the Elohim of Israel?’ Today you have turned away from following Yahweh by building an altar for yourselves. Today you have rebelled against Yahweh!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does the sin we committed at Peor mean nothing to us anymore? Didn’t we cleanse ourselves from it? Because of that sin there was a plague on Yahweh’s congregation!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have turned away from following Yahweh! Today you rebel against Yahweh, and tomorrow he will be angry with the whole congregation of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your land is unclean, come over here to Yahweh’s land. Yahweh’s tent is standing here. Take some property for yourselves among us. Don’t rebel against Yahweh or against us by building an altar for yourselves in addition to the altar of Yahweh our Elohim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Didn’t Achan, son of Zerah, act faithlessly with the things claimed by the Lord? Didn’t the Lord become angry with the whole congregation of Israel? Achan wasn’t the only one who died because of his sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the tribes of Reuben and Gad and half of the tribe of Manasseh answered the heads of the divisions of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Yahweh is the only true El! Yahweh is the only true El! He knows, so let Israel know! If our act is rebellious or unfaithful to Yahweh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: don’t spare us today. If we built an altar with the intention of no longer following Yahweh, and if we built it for making burnt offerings, grain offerings, or fellowship offerings, let Yahweh punish us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We were worried because of the situation we’re in. We thought sometime in the future your children might say to our children, ‘What relationship do you have with Yahweh Elohim of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh has made the Jordan River a dividing line between us and you, the descendants of Reuben and Gad. You have no connection with Yahweh!’ So your descendants would stop our descendants from worshiping Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then we said, ‘Let’s build an altar for ourselves. It will not be for burnt offerings or sacrifices,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but it will stand as a witness between us for generations to come. It will stand as a witness that we may worship in the presence of Yahweh with our burnt offerings, sacrifices, and fellowship offerings.’ Then your descendants cannot say to our descendants, ‘You have no connection with Yahweh!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we thought, if this statement is made to us or to our descendants in the future, we will answer, ‘Look at the model of Yahweh’s altar our ancestors made. They didn’t make it for burnt offerings or sacrifices but to stand as a witness between us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It would be unthinkable for us to rebel against Yahweh or to turn back today from following Yahweh by building an altar for burnt offerings, grain offerings, or sacrifices in addition to the altar of Yahweh our Elohim that is in front of his tent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the priest Phinehas, the leaders of the congregation, and the heads of the divisions of Israel heard what the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Manasseh said, they were satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Phinehas, son of the priest Eleazar, said to the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Manasseh, “Today we know Yahweh is among us, because you did not commit an unfaithful act against Yahweh. Now you have rescued the people of Israel from Yahweh’s punishment.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Phinehas (son of the priest Eleazar) and the leaders returned from Reuben and Gad in Gilead to Israel in Canaan and gave them the report.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Israel were satisfied with the report. So they praised Elohim and didn’t talk anymore about going to war against Reuben and Gad and destroying the land where they were living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tribes of Reuben and Gad gave the altar a name: Witness Between Us That Yahweh Is the Only True Elohim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A long time afterward, Yahweh gave the Israelites peace with all their enemies around them. Joshua was old, near the end of his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he called all the leaders, chiefs, judges, and officers of Israel together. He said to them, “I am old, near the end of my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have seen for yourselves everything Yahweh your Elohim did to all those nations. Yahweh your Elohim fought for you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have given you the territory of the nations that still remain as an inheritance for your tribes. This includes the territory of all the nations I have already destroyed from the Jordan River westward to the Mediterranean Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh your Elohim will expel them right in front of your eyes and force them out of your way. You will take their land as Yahweh your Elohim told you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you must be very strong to keep and to do everything written in the Book of Moses’ Teachings. Don’t turn away from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t get mixed up with the nations left in your territory. Don’t ever mention the names of their gods or swear an oath to them. Don’t ever serve their gods or bow down to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you must be loyal to Yahweh your Elohim, as you have been until now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh has forced important and powerful nations out of your way. Not one person has ever been able to stand up to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of you used to chase a thousand. That was because Yahweh your Elohim was fighting for you, as he had promised you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be very careful to love Yahweh your Elohim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if you turn away and go along with the other nations within your borders, if you intermarry with them or associate with them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you should know that Yahweh your Elohim will never again force these people out of your way. Instead, they will be a snare and a trap for you, a whip laid to your sides, and thorns in your eyes until none of you are left in this good land that Yahweh your Elohim has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Pay attention, because I will soon die like everyone else. You know with all your heart and soul that not one single promise which Yahweh your Elohim has given you has ever failed to come true. Every single word has come true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Every good word Yahweh your Elohim has promised you has come true for you. In the same way Yahweh will bring about every evil curse until he has destroyed you from this good land that he has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you ignore the conditions placed on you by Yahweh your Elohim and follow other gods, serve them and bow down to them, Yahweh will be angry with you. Then you will quickly disappear from the good land he has given you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua gathered all the tribes of Israel together at Shechem. He called together Israel’s leaders, chiefs, judges, and officers, and they presented themselves to Elohim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua said to all the people, “This is what Yahweh Elohim of Israel says: Long ago your ancestors, Terah and his sons Abraham and Nahor, lived on the other side of the Euphrates River and served other gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I took your ancestor Abraham from the other side of the Euphrates River. I led him through all of Canaan and gave him many descendants. I also gave him Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Isaac I gave Jacob and Esau. I gave Esau the mountains in Seir as his own. However, Jacob and his sons went to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then I sent Moses and Aaron, and I struck Egypt with plagues. Later I led you out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I led your ancestors out of Egypt, you came to the sea. The Egyptians with their chariots and horsemen chased your ancestors to the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When your ancestors cried out to Yahweh, he put darkness between you and the Egyptians. He made the sea flow back and cover them. You saw for yourselves what I did to Egypt. Then you lived in the desert for a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “After that I brought you to the land of the Amorites who lived on the east side of the Jordan River. They fought you. However, I handed them over to you. So you took their land, and I destroyed them in front of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak, son of King Zippor of Moab, fought Israel. He summoned Balaam, son of Beor, to curse you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I refused to listen to Balaam. All he could do was bless you. So I saved you from his power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you crossed the Jordan River and came to Jericho. The citizens of Jericho, the Amorites, Perizzites, Canaanites, Hittites, Girgashites, Hivites, and Jebusites fought you. But I handed them over to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I sent hornets ahead of you to force out the two kings of the Amorites ahead of you. These things didn’t happen because of your battle skills or fighting ability.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I gave you a land that you hadn’t farmed, cities to live in that you hadn’t built, vineyards and olive groves that you hadn’t planted. So you ate all you wanted!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Fear Yahweh, and serve him with integrity and faithfulness. Get rid of the gods your ancestors served on the other side of the Euphrates River and in Egypt, and serve only Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you don’t want to serve Yahweh, then choose today whom you will serve. Even if you choose the gods your ancestors served on the other side of the Euphrates or the gods of the Amorites in whose land you live, my family and I will still serve Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people responded, “It would be unthinkable for us to abandon Yahweh to serve other gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh our Elohim brought us and our ancestors out of slavery in Egypt. He did these spectacular signs right before our eyes. He guarded us wherever we went, especially as we passed through other nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh forced out all the people ahead of us, including the Amorites who lived in this land. We, too, will serve Yahweh, because he is our Elohim.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Joshua answered the people, “Since Yahweh is a holy Elohim, you can’t possibly serve him. He is El Kanna. He will not forgive your rebellious acts and sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you abandon Yahweh and serve foreign gods, he will turn and bring disaster on you. He will destroy you, although he has been so good to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people answered Joshua, “No! We will only serve Yahweh!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Joshua said to the people, “You have testified that you have chosen to serve Yahweh.”
They answered, “Yes, we have!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Get rid of the foreign gods that are among you. Turn yourselves entirely over to Yahweh Elohim of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people replied to Joshua, “We will serve Yahweh our Elohim and obey him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That day Joshua made an agreement for the people and set up laws and rules for them at Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua wrote these things in the Book of Elohim’s Teachings. Then he took a large stone and set it up under the oak tree at Yahweh’s holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua told all the people, “This stone will stand as a witness for us. It has heard all the words which Yahweh spoke to us. It will stand as a witness for you. You cannot deceive your Elohim.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joshua sent the people away, each to his own property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these events, Yahweh’s servant Joshua, son of Nun, died. He was 110 years old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was buried on his own land at Timnath Serah in the mountains of Ephraim north of Mount Gaash.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel served Yahweh as long as Joshua and the older leaders, who outlived him and who knew everything Yahweh had done for Israel, were alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph’s bones, which the people of Israel had brought from Egypt, were buried at Shechem. They were placed in the plot of ground Jacob had bought from the sons of Hamor, father of Shechem, for 100 pieces of silver. The plot was inherited by Joseph’s descendants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron’s son Eleazar also died. He was buried on the hill that had been given to his son Phinehas in the mountains of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator
